title: Chinese Embassy provides materials to the Ecuador Foundation for Children and Parents with Cancer in December 2021
description: On December 16, 2021, the Chinese Embassy donated materials to the Ecuador Foundation for Children and Parents with Cancer. This donation is part of a cooperation series with the Ecuador-China Parliamentary Friendship Group of the new Ecuadorian National Assembly. The purpose of this donation, and other cooperation work within this series, is to help disadvantaged groups in Ecuador. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Chen Guoyou, the Chinese Ambassador to Ecuador, the Vice Chairman of the Ecuadorian Opportunity Movement, members of the Ecuador-China Parliamentary Friendship Group, and the foundation’s chairman Gu Tierrez attended the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Chen Guoyou, the Chinese Ambassador to Ecuador, the Vice Chairman of the Ecuadorian Opportunity Movement, members of the Ecuador-China Parliamentary Friendship Group, and the foundation’s chairman Gu Tierrez attended the ceremony.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare support for disadvantaged groups without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation to cancer foundation, healthcare focus, social development purpose

title: Chinese Embassy grants 30 Chinese Ambassador Scholarships to students in Ecuador in December 2021
description: On December 15, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Ecuador held an online award ceremony for the 2021 "Chinese Ambassador Scholarship.” During the ceremony, 30 scholarships were provided to students in Ecuador. The monetary value of each scholarship is unknown.  About 300 people participated in the online award ceremony, including Chen Guoyou, the Chinese Ambassador to Ecuador, the heads of 5 Ecuador schools offering Chinese courses, teacher and student representatives, and the 30 winners of this year's "Chinese Ambassador Scholarship".
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

title: Chinese Embassy provides materials to Indigenous Communities in the Cotopaxi Province of Ecuador in December 2021
description: On December 17, 2021, the Chinese Embassy donated Christmas supplies to the indigenous communities of Ecuador’s Cotopaxi Province through the Ecuadorian Habitat Foundation. This donation is part of a series of social and livelihood projects meant to provide assistance to vulnerable groups in Ecuador. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Chen Guoyou, the Chinese Ambassador to Ecuador, attended the ceremony and handed over the materials to the Chairman of Ecuadors’ Habitat Foundation.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

title: Chinese Embassy provides office and anti-epidemic materials to the Quito Police Department in December 2021
description: On December 22, 2021, the Chinese Embassy donated office equipment and anti-epidemic materials to the Quito Police Department of Ecuador. The materials will be used to improve functions and COVID-19 response efforts of the police department. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to Ecuador, Chen Guoyou, and the Police Chief of Quito City, General Zapata, attended the ceremony and signed the handover certificate. Wang Xinming, the Political Counselor of the Embassy, also attended the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title

China’s Ambassador to Ecuador, Chen Guoyou, and the Police Chief of Quito City, General Zapata, attended the ceremony and signed the handover certificate. Wang Xinming, the Political Counselor of the Embassy, also attended the ceremony.
justification: Project focuses on social development through provision of office equipment and anti-epidemic materials to a police department

title: Chinese Embassy provides Christmas candy to children in the Orellana Province of Ecuador in December 2021
description: On December 24, 2021, the Chinese Embassy provided Christmas candy to children in the Orellana Province of Ecuador. The purpose of this donation is to emphasize China-Ecuador cooperation and bilateral relations. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to Ecuador, Chen Guoyou, and the President of the Ecuadorian Congress attended the ceremony. The Governor of the Orellana Province and other local dignitaries also attended the ceremony.

title: Chinese Embassy (joint with Huawei) provide school supplies to the Galapagos Province of Ecuador in October 2021 (linked to project #98861)
description: On October 21, 2021, the Chinese Embassy (recorded in this project) and Huawei’s Ecuador branch (project #98861) jointly donated tablets and school supplies to the Galapagos Province of Ecuador. The purpose of this donation is to improve educational efforts in Ecuador. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to Ecuador, Chen Guoyou, and the Governor of the Galapagos Province of Ecuador attended the ceremony.

title: Chinese Government sends anti-epidemic medical team to Ecuador in September 2021
description: On September 10, 2021, a medical team was sent from China to Ecuador to support the fight against COVID-19. The team was comprised of Lu Runping, a member of the Party Committee and Chief Physician of the municipal hospital, Zhang Chaowen, the Director of the outpatient department of the municipal hospital, and Huang Liang, the Chief of the Department of Infection and attending physician of the Fifth People's Hospital. The medical team stayed in Ecuador for 9 months. During their time in Ecuador, the team worked on COVID-19 prevention in the Mirador Copper Mine of Ecuador.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government sends anti-epidemic medical team to Ecuador in September 2021

# Description
On September 10, 2021, a medical team was sent from China to Ecuador to support the fight against COVID-19. The team was comprised of Lu Runping, a member of the Party Committee and Chief Physician of the municipal hospital, Zhang Chaowen, the Director of the outpatient department of the municipal hospital, and Huang Liang, the Chief of the Department of Infection and attending physician of the Fifth People's Hospital. The medical team stayed in Ecuador for 9 months. During their time in Ecuador, the team worked on COVID-19 prevention in the Mirador Copper Mine of Ecuador.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support and epidemic prevention, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical team sent for COVID-19 prevention, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Ministry of Education provides 300 scholarships to Ecuadorian students in May 2021
description: On May 10, 2021, the Chinese Ministry of Education signed an agreement with the Ecuadorian Ministry of Education to provide 300 scholarships in the following 5 years as a stimulus to Ecuadorian students of excellence who wish to pursue higher education studies in cutting-edge areas. The monetary value of each scholarship is unknown.
